title: Web Developer Intern
description:

**Location:** 
 Remote
 



**Duration:** 
 3 Months
 



**Employment Opportunity:** 
 Potential full\\-time role based on performance, with a Certificate of Internship.
 



**About Webs IT Solution** 




 Webs IT Solution is a technology and innovation company offering hands\\-on training and project\\-based internships in software development, web technologies, AI, data, and cybersecurity. We focus on bridging the gap between academic learning and industry requirements through live projects and expert mentorship.

 As a

 with live deployment.

title: TTT - Manual plus Automation - Staff
description:
At EY, we‚Äôre all in to shape your future with confidence.
   

  

 We‚Äôll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.
   

  

 Join EY and help to build a better working world.
   

  

**Staff Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer**
**Summary:**
 We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Staff QA Engineer with a maximum of 5 years of experience in both Manual and Automated testing. The ideal candidate will be a critical thinker, proficient in modern QA practices, and possess hands\\-on experience with industry\\-leading automation tools, specifically Selenium and Playwright. This role is pivotal in driving our product quality and fostering continuous improvement within our testing processes.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Requirements and Test Strategy:**
* Actively participate in requirement analysis and collaborate with product and development teams to clarify Use Cases and User Stories.
* Proactively seek and document clarifications to resolve ambiguities and maintain a clear understanding of project scope.
* Design comprehensive Test Scenarios and detailed Test Cases, ensuring complete traceability to initial requirements.
* Conduct timely and thorough reviews of test artifacts prepared by peers and other team members.


**Execution and Defect Management:**
* Execute Manual and Automated test cases across various testing types (e.g., Regression, Smoke, System, API, Mobile/Web).
* Utilize expertise in Selenium and Playwright to develop, maintain, and execute robust automation scripts.
* Perform REST/SOAP API testing using tools like Postman.
* Identify, categorize, and report defects/bugs accurately, providing clear steps to reproduce.
* Collaborate closely with the Development team to facilitate issue resolution and track defects to closure.
* Immediately raise flags for critical issues, blockers, or major impediments.


**Quality and Process Improvement:**
* Manage and own QA deliverables, ensuring all assigned tasks meet established quality criteria and timelines.
* Strive to continually raise the standards of QA processes, procedures, and documentation within the team.
* Monitor the progress and quality of the project, proactively managing and mitigating any arising hindrances.
* Be accountable for all assigned QA tasks, focusing on delivering a consistently high\\-quality final product.


**Required Qualifications And Skills**
* Experience: Around 5 years in QA software testing, including both functional and non\\-functional testing, within complex, project\\-based environments.


**Automation Expertise (Hands\\-on is Mandatory):**
* Demonstrated experience in developing and maintaining robust test automation frameworks using Selenium and Playwright.
* Practical experience and strong proficiency with Playwright.


**Technical \\& Testing Skills:**
* Proven experience in REST/SOAP API testing using tools such as Postman.
* Hands\\-on experience with SQL queries, including knowledge of joins and views.
* Experience in testing both Mobile and Web applications.
* Solid understanding of various testing types (e.g., Black\\-box, White\\-box, Regression, Smoke, Sanity, System, Accessibility).


**Process \\& Tools:**
* Deep operational experience within the Agile/SCRUM; knowledge of SAFe is a plus.
* Hands\\-on experience with Test Management tools (e.g., ALM, JIRA, Azure DevOps).
* Strong background working within a standard Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).


**Soft Skills:**
* Excellent communication (written and verbal) and collaborative skills for working effectively within cross\\-functional and intercultural teams.
* Proven ability to work independently, demonstrating strong rational analysis and logical thinking.
* Great team player with strong interpersonal skills and a solid work ethic.
* Commitment to continuous learning and improvement in software testing best practices.


**EY \\| Building a better working world**
 EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.
   

  

 EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi\\-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

title: MERN Stack Developer Intern ‚Äì Full Stack Web Apps
description:
**üíª MERN Stack Developer Intern ‚Äì Full Stack Web Apps \\| Virtual Internship \\| Flexible Timing \\| Real Industry Projects** 




 We‚Äôre accelerating our product engineering pipeline and onboarding execution\\-focused talent as
 **MERN Stack Developer Interns** 
 . This internship provides deep, hands\\-on exposure to
 **full\\-stack application development** 
 , covering everything from UI components to backend logic and database operations.
 



**Note:** 
 This is
 *not* 
 a stipend\\-based internship.\\*
 



**üîπ Internship Snapshot** 



* **Role:** 
 MERN Stack Developer Intern ‚Äì Full Stack Web Apps
* **Mode:** 
 100% Virtual Internship
* **Timing:** 
 Fully Flexible ‚Äî ideal for students managing academic workloads
* **Compensation:** 
 Unpaid; value delivered through real engineering project exposure
* **Eligibility:** 
 Students \\& freshers with foundational knowledge of MERN technologies



**üîπ What You Will Work On (Project Scope)** 




 Interns will build and deploy
 **real, industry\\-oriented full\\-stack applications** 
 , including:
 


* **Front\\-end:** 
 React components, state management, responsive UI
* **Back\\-end:** 
 Node.js \\& Express\\-based API development
* **Database:** 
 MongoDB schema design, queries, aggregation pipelines
* **Authentication \\& Authorization:** 
 JWT\\-based access workflows
* **Integration:** 
 Connecting APIs, UI, and databases into a cohesive system
* **Deployment simulations:** 
 Git workflows, hosting basics, environment variables



 These deliverables simulate real full\\-stack engineering environments.
 



**üîπ Core Responsibilities** 



* Develop modular, reusable full\\-stack features
* Build and integrate REST APIs
* Maintain clean, well\\-documented codebases
* Debug and optimize both frontend and backend components
* Collaborate with design and backend teams for seamless integration
* Deliver milestones aligned with sprint/project timelines
* Participate in code reviews and iteration cycles



**üîπ What You Gain** 



* End\\-to\\-end full\\-stack development experience
* Portfolio\\-ready applications showcasing complete MERN workflows
* Exposure to real engineering methodologies and best practices
* Flexible timings with output\\-driven expectations
* Completion certificate based on performance
* Strong readiness for full\\-stack and product engineering roles



**üîπ Ideal Candidate Profile** 



* Solid understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React
* Basic experience with Node.js, Express, and MongoDB
* Strong problem\\-solving orientation
* Comfortable converting requirements into functional modules
* Ownership\\-driven, consistent, and detail\\-focused

title: Senior Analyst
description:
**Job Description**
**Job Summary:**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **.NET Developer** 
 with strong expertise in
 **.NET Core** 
 and
 **SQL** 
 . The ideal candidate will be an
 **individual contributor** 
 capable of working independently across the
 **Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)** 
 or in
 **Agile** 
 environments. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust and scalable applications.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain applications using .NET Core and related technologies.
* Write efficient and optimized SQL queries and procedures.
* Participate in all phases of SDLC including requirement analysis, design, development, testing, and deployment.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues across environments.
* Work independently with minimal supervision and take ownership of deliverables.
* Follow Agile methodologies and participate in sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives.


**Required Skills:**
* Strong proficiency in .NET Core, C\\#, and ASP.NET.
* Solid experience with SQL Server or other relational databases.
* Good understanding of SDLC and Agile development practices.
* Experience with RESTful APIs, LINQ, Entity Framework.
* Familiarity with version control systems like Git.
* Excellent problem\\-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
* Exposure to front\\-end technologies like Angular or React is an advantage.


**About The Team**
 eClerx is a global leader in productized services, bringing together people, technology and domain expertise to amplify business results. Our mission is to set the benchmark for client service and success in our industry. Our vision is to be the innovation partner of choice for technology, data analytics and process management services. Since our inception in 2000, we've partnered with top companies across various industries, including financial services, telecommunications, retail, and high\\-tech. Our innovative solutions and domain expertise help businesses optimize operations, improve efficiency, and drive growth. With over 18,000 employees worldwide, eClerx is dedicated to delivering excellence through smart automation and data\\-driven insights. At eClerx, we believe in nurturing talent and providing hands\\-on experience.
   

  

 eClerx is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, per applicable law.

title: Quality Assurance Lead
description:
"5\\+ years of experience in test automation, Strong hands\\-on experience with Playwright using JavaScript/TypeScript. Proficiency in DevOps tools and practices, including CI/CD, version control (Git), and infrastructure automation. Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and managing test execution in containerized environments. Familiarity with AI/ML in testing ‚Äì such as test impact analysis, visual testing, or self\\-healing automation. Solid understanding of REST APIs, web technologies, and cross\\-browser testing. Experience with test reporting tools like Allure, ReportPortal, or custom dashboards. Strong problem\\-solving, debugging, and analytical skills."
   

  

 "Lead the design, development, and maintenance of end\\-to\\-end test automation frameworks using Playwright (JS/TS). Define and implement automation strategies aligned with Agile and DevOps methodologies. Integrate test automation into CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, or Azure DevOps. Leverage AI/ML techniques for intelligent test case generation, self\\-healing scripts, and predictive defect analysis. Manage and optimize test execution in containerized environments using Docker and Kubernetes. Collaborate with developers, QA, DevOps, and product teams to ensure high\\-quality releases. Drive code quality through peer reviews, code coverage analysis, and static code analysis. Monitor and report on test results, automation coverage, and quality metrics. Mentor and guide junior automation engineers and QA team members."

title: Member of Technical Staff (AI Supportability)
description:
Category\\-defining tech. Career\\-defining work.
   

  

 Lots of tech companies disrupt. But, many fail when they try to scale. We're different. CockroachDB makes it easier for companies to build and scale apps. This is how and why we're helping some of the most innovative companies on the planet. We tackle problems head\\-on and focus on solutions that create lasting impact.
   

  

 Because when our customers win, we all win.
   

  

**The Role**
 Can LLMs accurately diagnose complex database issues from telemetry data? We're building a team to prove this.
   

  

 Supporting CockroachDB is inherently challenging. Our product has thousands of unique metrics, complex structured data, and emits detailed logs at high frequency, making support tickets expensive and time\\-consuming to resolve. We're launching an R\\&D initiative to explore how Applied AI can reduce these support costs and improve diagnostic accuracy.
   

  

 We're looking for engineers who thrive in exploratory, prototype\\-driven environments working closely with end users. You'll start with a concrete mission: validate whether LLMs can perform root cause analysis on real Zendesk escalations using CockroachDB telemetry data. Working embedded with our technical support engineers, you'll experiment with OpenAI/Anthropic APIs, prompt engineering techniques, and various data contexts to determine if AI can transform diagnostic workflows.
   

  

 This isn't about executing a predetermined roadmap. It's about rapid experimentation, learning from real data, and building the foundation for AI\\-powered support workflows. If you're energized by building from scratch, working directly with internal stakeholders, and technical challenges where the outcome isn't guaranteed, this role is for you.
   

  

**You Will**
* Start with focused validation: Design experiments to test whether LLMs can assist with root cause analysis on real Zendesk escalations, determining if AI can accelerate diagnostic workflows and reduce time\\-to\\-resolution.
* Work embedded with our Bangalore technical support team: Partner with support engineers through regular collaboration sessions to understand diagnostic workflows, review experimental results, and gather insights.
* Work with real CockroachDB data: Process diagnostic telemetry including cluster metrics, SQL traces, system logs, plus observability data.
* Iterate on AI approaches: Experiment with OpenAI/Anthropic APIs, prompt engineering techniques, and different data contexts to optimize LLM diagnostic performance.
* Build rapid prototypes: Transform promising validation results into proof\\-of\\-concept tools and agents, defining next steps based on what the data tells us.
* Measure and document progress: Establish clear success metrics for LLM accuracy and track experimental results throughout the validation process.
* Scale successful experiments: Use Go, Python, and cloud infrastructure to build scalable applications from validated prototype.
* Explore advanced AI patterns: As validation results warrant, investigate sophisticated approaches like agentic workflows, MCP integrations, and multi\\-step reasoning chains for complex diagnostic scenarios


**The Expectations**
 In the first month, you will join the AI Supportability team and immerse yourself in CockroachDB's observability landscape and support workflows. Embed with technical support engineers to understand diagnostic challenges firsthand while beginning LLM experimentation for supportability use cases.
   

  

 After 3 months, you'll have validated core assumptions about LLM\\-powered diagnostics and be actively prototyping the next\\-generation of AI support tools. You will have established strong collaborative relationships with technical support teams and identified the most promising areas for AI automation based on real experimental data.
   

  

 As this initiative grows, you will have the opportunity to define the future of AI\\-driven customer support at Cockroach Labs. Your Applied AI work will establish whether and how AI can scale our support organization, potentially influencing product development for improved customer self\\-service. This initiative will determine our long\\-term AI supportability strategy.
   

  

**You Have**
* Experimental mindset: You're energized by ambiguous problems, rapid prototyping, and discovering solutions through data\\-driven experimentation
* Applied AI/ML work: Experience with LLMs, prompt engineering, and model evaluation through professional work, significant side projects, or deep technical exploration
* Strong programming skills: Proficiency in Go, Python or similar languages, with ability to quickly learn new technologies and APIs
* Data and systems experience: Comfort working with large\\-scale structured data, APIs, observability tools, logs, metrics, and distributed systems concepts
* Greenfield experience: Background building new products, prototypes, or research projects where the solution path wasn't predefined
* Embedded collaboration experience: Experience working directly with internal stakeholders, gathering requirements, and iterating based on user feedback
* Technical communication: Ability to explain complex experimental results and technical concepts to diverse audiences
* Ideally 5\\+ years of software engineering experience with hands\\-on AI/ML work, but we prioritize your ability to learn, experiment, and deliver measurable results
* BE/B\\-Tech/M\\-Tech in Computer Science or equivalent experience


**The Team**
**Abhishek Munnolimath** 
 \\- Senior Engineering Manager
   

  

 You will report directly to Abhishek, who will be leading the execution of the AI Supportability roadmap, managing the team's technical direction, and ensuring focus on delivering measurable improvements to support efficiency.
   

  

 Abhishek joined Cockroach Labs in April 2025 as a Senior Engineering Manager for Cloud Engineering in India, leading the Cloud Admin, SRE, Observability, and Cloud Platform teams. With 15\\+ years of experience across Microsoft, Oracle, and SaaS companies like Freshworks, he brings deep expertise in cloud services, security, and distributed systems. Passionate about people leadership, mentoring, and business impact, he is excited by Cockroach Labs‚Äô potential to disrupt industries like gaming, e\\-commerce, and financial services. Outside work, he enjoys yoga, travel, and time with his two daughters.
   

  

**Namrata Kodali** 
 \\- Director of Engineering
   

  

 Namrata leads the AI Supportability initiative, defining the strategic roadmap and partnering with Abhishek to drive technical execution of this effort.
   

  

 Namrata joined Cockroach Labs in 2020, and leads the Observability teams. Previously, she spent several years at Yext in New York City, leading teams working on everything from their API and platform to billing and subscriptions. She was initially drawn to Cockroach Labs' culture and people, and has developed a passion for working in Observability, helping make CockroachDB more understandable. Outside of work, she enjoys spending time outdoors, climbing, biking, and hiking.
   

  

**BabuSrithar** 
 \\- Site Lead, India
   

  

 BabuSrithar is the Site Leader for India. He is responsible for our growth strategy and is a cultural champion in the region. He is passionate about building high\\-quality software products and lean teams by leveraging everyone's potential. He enjoys working with people and learning along the way. Before joining Cockroach Labs, BabuSrithar held senior leadership positions at companies like Nutanix, Clumio and recently he was VP of engineering at Apty where he led the engineering globally. When not at work, he enjoys his time with his 5\\-year\\-old and family.
   

  

 Cockroach Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you need additional accommodations to feel comfortable during your interview process, please email us at accessibility@cockroachlabs.com.
   

  

 Cockroach Labs has a hybrid work model, with Roachers that are local to one of our offices coming in on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays and working flexibly the rest of the week. While we‚Äôve learned valuable lessons working remotely, nothing can replace the connection, creativity, and fun that occurs when Roachers get together and we are committed to fostering a workplace that encourages collaboration and allows us all to do our best work.

description:
**DevOps Consultant** 




**India ‚Äì Remote** 




**Positions \\- 3** 




**Full\\-Time / Contract** 




  





**Job Summary** 




 The DevOps Consultant will lead the design and implementation of scalable DevOps solutions across hybrid environments, supporting production\\-grade builds and enterprise platform development. This role requires strong expertise in Helm Charts, DevOps tooling, and cloud\\-native practices, along with the ability to influence stakeholders and drive DevOps transformation initiatives. The ideal candidate will bring strategic thinking from a Practice or Center of Excellence background and stay current with industry trends such as SRE, AIOps, telemetry, and chaos engineering. This is a remote role based in India with two open positions.
 



  





**Key Skills**

* DevOps architecture and solution design in hybrid environments
* CI/CD pipeline design and optimization
* Production build and release management
* DevOps documentation, metrics, and governance



**Kubernetes \\& Packaging**

**Cloud \\& Modern DevOps Practices** 



* Hybrid and multi\\-cloud environments
* Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

* Telemetry, observability, and monitoring
* Chaos engineering and resilience testing



**Leadership \\& Stakeholder Management** 



* DevOps transformation strategy

**Minimum Qualifications**

 of experience as a Senior Software Engineer, DevOps Lead, or DevOps Consultant.

title: Principal Lead AI Engineering
description:
As a Principal Tech Lead for the Generative AI team, you will spearhead the design, development, and deployment of advanced AI solutions leveraging cutting\\-edge technologies. This role demands deep expertise in Python programming, Generative AI frameworks, and orchestration tools, along with hands\\-on experience in building scalable AI systems on cloud platforms. You will lead a team of engineers and collaborate with data scientists, product managers, and architects to deliver innovative, secure, and high\\-performing AI solutions.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities¬∑ Architect and implement Generative AI solutions using Python and modern AI frameworks.
   

  

* Lead development efforts involving LangChain, LangGraph, LangSmith, and agentic AI workflows.
* Integrate and optimize AI models on Azure OpenAI, AWS Bedrock, and other cloud platforms.
* Design and manage multi\\-agent systems leveraging MCP (Model Context Protocol) for orchestration.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to define technical strategy, best practices, and coding standards.
* Ensure scalability, security, and compliance in AI deployments across enterprise environments.
* Mentor and guide engineers on advanced AI concepts, coding practices, and system design.
* Stay ahead of trends in Generative AI, LLMs, and agent\\-based architectures to drive innovation.


 Required Qualifications¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
   

  

* 10\\+ years of experience in software development, with at least 4\\+ years in AI/ML systems.
* Strong proficiency in Python and experience with AI libraries (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow).
* Hands\\-on expertise with LangChain, LangGraph, LangSmith, and related orchestration tools.
* Proven experience with Azure OpenAI, AWS Bedrock, and cloud\\-native AI deployments.
* Knowledge of MCP and multi\\-agent architectures for AI workflows.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), and microservices.
* Excellent problem\\-solving, communication, and leadership skills.


 Preferred Qualifications¬∑ Experience in agentic AI systems and autonomous workflow design.
   

  

* Exposure to prompt engineering, LLM fine\\-tuning, and evaluation metrics.
* Understanding of ethical AI principles, bias detection, and responsible AI practices.
* Contributions to open\\-source AI projects or published research in Generative AI.

 Ameriprise India LLP has been providing client based financial solutions to help clients plan and achieve their financial objectives for 125 years. We are a U.S. based financial planning company headquartered in Minneapolis with a global presence. You‚Äôll also have plenty of opportunities to make your mark at the office and a difference in your community.
